Package swiftbot

Class SwiftBotAPI

java.lang.Object
swiftbot.SwiftBotAPI
public class SwiftBotAPI extends Object
The SwiftBot API allows you to interface with your SwiftBot's features and functionalities.
Version:
4.0.2
Author:
Robert Shuttleworth, Josephine Smith, Sophie Chaveli

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static enum 
    SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize
    Image sizes that can be used when capturing an image using the SwiftBot's camera.
    static enum 
    SwiftBotAPI.Underlight
    Each Underlight controls one of the six lights found on the underside of the SwiftBot.

  • Constructor Details

    • SwiftBotAPI

      public SwiftBotAPI() throws ExceptionInInitializerError
      SwiftBotAPI constructor which allows the creation of a SwiftBot instance.
      Throws:
      ExceptionInInitializerError - if I2C is disabled on your SwiftBot.

  • Method Details

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Correctly shuts down the GPIO controller and unprovisions all input pins.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • startMove

      public void startMove(int leftVelocity, int rightVelocity)
      Powers the SwiftBot's motors (selected by the user via leftVelocity and rightVelocity) indefinitely.
      Parameters:
      leftVelocity - is an int from -100 to 100 which determines the speed and direction of the left wheel. Negative values move the wheel backwards and positive values move the wheel forwards. This value should be viewed as a percentage with 1 or -1 moving slowly and 100 or -100 moving at full speed. If the value is 0, the wheel's motor will not be powered.
      rightVelocity - works the same as leftVelocity.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • stopMove

      public void stopMove()
      Powers all the SwiftBot's motors off.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • move

      public void move(int leftVelocity, int rightVelocity, int timeToHold) throws InterruptedException
      Powers the SwiftBot's motors (selected by the user via leftVelocity and rightVelocity) for timeToHold milliseconds.
      Parameters:
      leftVelocity - is an int from -100 to 100 which determines the speed and direction of the left wheel. Negative values move the wheel backwards and positive values move the wheel forwards. This value should be viewed as a percentage with 1 or -1 moving slowly and 100 or -100 moving at full speed. If the value is 0, the wheel's motor will not be powered.
      rightVelocity - works the same as leftVelocity.
      timeToHold - is an int which determines how many milliseconds the SwiftBot's motors will be powered for.
      Throws:
      InterruptedException - if the thread is interrupted whilst sleeping.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • takeStill

      public BufferedImage takeStill(String filePath, String fileName, SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize size) throws IOException, com.hopding.jrpicam.exceptions.FailedToRunRaspistillException, InterruptedException
      Uses the SwiftBot's camera to take a picture (file type png) and saves it to a user-determined custom file path with a custom file name. This image is then returned as a BufferedImage.
      Parameters:
      filePath - is a String containing a file path to the destination that the captured image will be saved.
      fileName - is a String which will become the file name of the captured image. .png will be added to the end of the String if it is not present.
      imageSize - is an SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize used to determine the height and width of the square image captured within this method.
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage of the newly captured image by the SwiftBot; if there are any errors, an error message will be printed and null will be returned.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error whilst taking the picture.
      InterruptedException - if there is an error whilst taking the picture.
      com.hopding.jrpicam.exceptions.FailedToRunRaspistillException - if there is an error whilst instantiating the camera.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize

    • takeStill

      public BufferedImage takeStill(String filePath, String fileName, SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize size, boolean print) throws IOException, com.hopding.jrpicam.exceptions.FailedToRunRaspistillException, InterruptedException
      Uses the SwiftBot's camera to take a picture (file type png) and saves it to a user-determined custom file path with a custom file name. This image is then returned as a BufferedImage.
      Parameters:
      filePath - is a String containing a file path to the destination that the captured image will be saved.
      fileName - is a String which will become the file name of the captured image. .png will be added to the end of the String if it is not present.
      imageSize - is an SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize used to determine the height and width of the square image captured within this method.
      print - is a boolean which can be used to output the file path when the image is successfully saved.
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage of the newly captured image by the SwiftBot; if there are any errors, an error message will be printed and null will be returned.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error whilst taking the picture.
      InterruptedException - if there is an error whilst taking the picture.
      com.hopding.jrpicam.exceptions.FailedToRunRaspistillException - if there is an error whilst instantiating the camera.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize

    • takeGrayscaleStill

      public BufferedImage takeGrayscaleStill(String filePath, String fileName, SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize size) throws IOException, com.hopding.jrpicam.exceptions.FailedToRunRaspistillException, InterruptedException
      Uses the SwiftBot's camera to take a black-and-white picture (file type png) and saves it to a user-determined custom file path with a custom file name. This image is then returned as a BufferedImage.
      Parameters:
      filePath - is a String containing a file path to the destination that the captured image will be saved.
      fileName - is a String which will become the file name of the captured image. .png will be added to the end of the String if it is not present.
      size - is an SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize used to determine the height and width of the square image captured within this method.
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage of the newly captured image by the SwiftBot; if there are any errors, an error message will be printed and null will be returned.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error whilst taking the picture.
      InterruptedException - if there is an error whilst taking the picture.
      com.hopding.jrpicam.exceptions.FailedToRunRaspistillException - if there is an error whilst instantiating the camera.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize

    • takeGrayscaleStill

      public BufferedImage takeGrayscaleStill(String filePath, String fileName, SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize size, boolean print) throws com.hopding.jrpicam.exceptions.FailedToRunRaspistillException, IOException, InterruptedException
      Uses the SwiftBot's camera to take a black-and-white picture (file type png) and saves it to a user-determined custom file path with a custom file name. This image is then returned as a BufferedImage.
      Parameters:
      filePath - is a String containing a file path to the destination that the captured image will be saved.
      fileName - is a String which will become the file name of the captured image. .png will be added to the end of the String if it is not present.
      imageSize - is an SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize used to determine the height and width of the square image captured within this method.
      print - is a boolean which can be used to output the file path when the image is successfully saved.
      Returns:
      a BufferedImage of the newly captured image by the SwiftBot; if there are any errors, an error message will be printed and null will be returned.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error whilst taking the picture.
      InterruptedException - if there is an error whilst taking the picture.
      com.hopding.jrpicam.exceptions.FailedToRunRaspistillException - if there is an error whilst instantiating the camera.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.ImageSize

    • setButtonLightA

      public void setButtonLightA(boolean state)
      Sets the LED to next to the button to the passed in input state.
      Parameters:
      state - is a boolean that is used to select if the light is powered or not. If true the light is on; if false the light is off.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • getButtonLightA

      public boolean getButtonLightA()
      Tests if the selected button light is currently on and returns a boolean.

      a boolean with a value of true if the light is currently powered or false if the light is not powered.
      Since:

    • useUltrasound

      public double useUltrasound()
      Uses the SwiftBot's ultrasound sensor to calculate the distance from the front of the SwiftBot to its nearest obstacle. Multiple measurements are made and the median is returned to increase accuracy.

      Typically returns a value around 1219 when a reading fails. Readings can fail if there is nothing for the ultrasound pulse to bounce off of, or depending on the surface (glass can often return inaccurate readings).

      Returns:
      a double of the distance to the nearest obstacle directly in front of the SwiftBot in centimetres.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • updateUnderlights

      public void updateUnderlights() throws IOException
      Updates the SwiftBot's underlighting to output currently stored values.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • #Underlight

    • disableUnderlights

      public void disableUnderlights()
      Sets all underlights' RGB intensities to 0.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • #Underlight

    • disableUnderlight

      public void disableUnderlight(SwiftBotAPI.Underlight underlight) throws IOException
      Sets a specific Underlight's RGB intensity to 0.

      To stop the underlight from automatically updating to its new value, use disableUnderlight(Underlight, boolean) and set update to false.

      Parameters:
      underlight - is used to select a specific Underlight to disable.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.Underlight

    • disableUnderlight

      public void disableUnderlight(SwiftBotAPI.Underlight underlight, boolean update) throws IOException
      Sets a specific Underlight's RGB intensity to 0.
      Parameters:
      underlight - is used to select a specific Underlight to disable.
      update - is a boolean that determines if the underlighting is automatically updated. If true, the input light will immediately update; if false, this light's intensity will be saved until updateUnderlights() is called.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.Underlight

    • setUnderlight

      public void setUnderlight(SwiftBotAPI.Underlight underlight, int r, int g, int b) throws IOException
      Sets an individual Underlight to a passed in RGB value.

      To stop the underlight from automatically updating to its new value, use setUnderlight(Underlight, int, int, int, boolean) and set update to false.

      Parameters:
      underlight - is used to select a specific Underlight.
      r - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's red light.
      g - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's green light.
      b - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's blue light.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      IllegalArgumentException - when an rgb value is less than 0 or greater than 255.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.Underlight

    • setUnderlight

      public void setUnderlight(SwiftBotAPI.Underlight underlight, int r, int g, int b, boolean update) throws IOException, IllegalArgumentException
      Sets an individual Underlight to a passed in RGB value.
      Parameters:
      underlight - is used to select a specific Underlight.
      r - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's red light.
      g - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's green light.
      b - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's blue light.
      update - is a boolean that determines if the underlighting is automatically updated. If true, the input light will immediately update; if false, this light's intensity will be saved until updateUnderlights() is called.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      IllegalArgumentException - when an rgb value is less than 0 or greater than 255.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.Underlight

    • setUnderlight

      public void setUnderlight(SwiftBotAPI.Underlight underlight, int[] rgb) throws IOException
      Sets an individual Underlight to a passed in RGB value.

      To stop the underlight from automatically updating to its new value, use setUnderlight(Underlight, int[], boolean) and set update to false.

      Parameters:
      underlight - is used to select a specific Underlight.
      rgb - is an int array of length 3. Index 0 contains the red light value; index 1 contains the green light value; index 2 contains the blue light value.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      IllegalArgumentException - when an rgb value is less than 0 or greater than 255.
      IllegalArgumentException - when rgb's size is not 3.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.Underlight

    • setUnderlight

      public void setUnderlight(SwiftBotAPI.Underlight underlight, int[] rgb, boolean update) throws IOException, IllegalArgumentException
      Sets an individual Underlight to an input RGB value.
      Parameters:
      underlight - is used to select a specific Underlight.
      rgb - is an int array of length 3. Index 0 contains the red light value; index 1 contains the green light value; index 2 contains the blue light value.
      update - is a boolean that determines if the underlighting is automatically updated. If true, the input light will immediately update; if false, this light's intensity will be saved until updateUnderlights() is called.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      IllegalArgumentException - when an rgb value is less than 0 or greater than 255.
      IllegalArgumentException - when rgb's size is not 3.
      Since:
      4.0.0
      See Also:
      • SwiftBotAPI.Underlight

    • fillUnderlights

      public void fillUnderlights(int r, int g, int b) throws IOException
      Sets all underlights to the same RGB value.
      Parameters:
      r - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's red light.
      g - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's green light.
      b - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's blue light.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      IllegalArgumentException - if r, g, or b are less than 0 or greater than 255.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • fillUnderlights

      public void fillUnderlights(int r, int g, int b, boolean update) throws IOException
      Sets all underlights to the same RGB value.
      Parameters:
      r - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's red light.
      g - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's green light.
      b - is an int from 0 to 255 that sets the intensity of the selected light's blue light.
      update - is a boolean that determines if the underlighting is automatically updated. If true, the input light will immediately update; if false, this light's intensity will be saved until updateUnderlights() is called.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      IllegalArgumentException - if r, g, or b are less than 0 or greater than 255.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • fillUnderlights

      public void fillUnderlights(int[] rgb) throws IOException
      Sets all underlights to the same RGB value.
      Parameters:
      rgb - is an int array of length 3. Index 0 contains the red light value; index 1 contains the green light value; index 2 contains the blue light value.
      Throws:
      IOException - if there is an error updating the underlighting.
      IllegalArgumentException - if r, g, or b are less than 0 or greater than 255.
      IllegalArgumentException - when rgb's size is not 3.
      Since:
      4.0.0

    • fillUnderlights

      public void fillUnderlights(int[] rgb, boolean update) throws IOException
      Sets all underlights to the same RGB value.
      Parameters:
      rgb - is an int array of length 3. Index 0 contains the red light value; index 1 contains the green light value; index 2 contains the blue light value.
      update - is a boolean that determines if the underlighting is automatically updated. If true, the input light will immediately update; if false, this light's intensity will be saved until updateUnderlights() is called.
      Throws:

    • checkArray

      public void checkArray(int[] rgb)
      Checks if input int[] is a valid RGB value.
      Parameters:
      rgb - is an int array of length 3. Index 0 contains the red value; index 1 contains the green value; index 2 contains the blue value.
      Since:
      4.0.0
